channel.title: Graphical Non-Continuity Errors
channel.description:
Graphics settings:
[img]https://cloud.steampowered.com/ugc/900974823180831272/7F1A3AF026589DC408768B41A19BBD13FD66D5A0/[/img]
Graphics is: NVIDIA® GeForce® GTX 460M 1.5GB GDDR5 VRAM [url]https://www.asus.com/Notebooks/Gaming_Powerhouse/G73SW/[/url] I have the "Intel® Core™ i7 2630QM" model.
I'll edit this post with more stuff as I find it; my previous screenshots do not have locations so I'll save those until I have positions.
[img]https://cloud.steampowered.com/ugc/900974823179753600/C7250BC25BE486058FE716735AF2869476E7F00F/[/img]
The spools on this computer (at least) are running incorrect. The right hand spool is running clockwise, but the left hand spool is running counterclockwise. They need to run the same direction or else there should be tape all over the floor :smiley:
Verified that this is, at least, all the computers on mb_c1a4c. Might just be this entity. The spool speeds are accurate (due to differing amount of tape the reels turn at a differential) but the directions are wrong.
version : 1.0.1.0/14 4104 insecure map : bm_c1a4c at: -2926 x, 683 y, 1216 z setpos -2926.556885 683.568726 1216.031250;setang -7.576402 93.375992 0.000000
[img]https://cloud-2.steampowered.com/ugc/900974823180574391/06A2CD6EB2091CEF31AD9B3E86DF5730F93772E6/[/img] [img]https://cloud-2.steampowered.com/ugc/900974823180582772/DB3B7FDA4CF48A1702A4D88EF53A89B1DADEAD24/[/img] [img]https://cloud.steampowered.com/ugc/900974823180594495/99233EA5895DAA1814ADC49C75AEDEC4A038707B/[/img] [img]https://cloud.steampowered.com/ugc/900974823180599390/DF32A8FDEA94DC86021ABBED51E08725EFB9EAEC/[/img] [img]https://cloud.steampowered.com/ugc/900974823180667078/C5D58B7A251645A21D0EA77DDDF41B834FDB6873/[/img] [img]https://cloud-2.steampowered.com/ugc/900974823180695853/0041FFBAB36A3F856C6EDCCC6A3D5D2D72394AFE/[/img]
map : bm_c1a4e at: 863 x, -1337 y, -1995 z setpos 863.278564 -1337.214844 -1995.968750;setang 35.936047 8.020986 0.000000 or setpos 2069.711914 583.260803 -2263.968750;setang 52.912357 -16.962515 0.000000
The last one (second setpos) is the more interesting one. The propane tank isn't a physics object; I can't move it or "use" it, but as I shine my light in it's general direction I see all kinds of weird flashlight clipping issues. Same thing with the valve-stem in earlier shots. Don't know if it's related.

item.title: Graphical Non-Continuity Errors
item.dc:creator: vktech
item.description:
Thanks for all the detail! And nice rig by the way. I have seen so many flashlight issues that make me want to cry… oh well, I’m sure they’ll get around to fixing them.

Read full topic

item.title: Graphical Non-Continuity Errors
item.dc:creator: AutoDMC
item.description:
Graphics settings:

Graphics is: NVIDIA® GeForce® GTX 460M 1.5GB GDDR5 VRAM
https://www.asus.com/Notebooks/Gaming_Powerhouse/G73SW/
I have the “Intel® Core™ i7 2630QM” model.

I’ll edit this post with more stuff as I find it; my previous screenshots do not have locations so I’ll save those until I have positions.

The spools on this computer (at least) are running incorrect. The right hand spool is running clockwise, but the left hand spool is running counterclockwise. They need to run the same direction or else there should be tape all over the floor

Verified that this is, at least, all the computers on mb_c1a4c. Might just be this entity. The spool speeds are accurate (due to differing amount of tape the reels turn at a differential) but the directions are wrong.

version : 1.0.1.0/14 4104 insecure
map : bm_c1a4c at: -2926 x, 683 y, 1216 z
setpos -2926.556885 683.568726 1216.031250;setang -7.576402 93.375992 0.000000






map : bm_c1a4e at: 863 x, -1337 y, -1995 z
setpos 863.278564 -1337.214844 -1995.968750;setang 35.936047 8.020986 0.000000
or
setpos 2069.711914 583.260803 -2263.968750;setang 52.912357 -16.962515 0.000000

The last one (second setpos) is the more interesting one. The propane tank isn’t a physics object; I can’t move it or “use” it, but as I shine my light in it’s general direction I see all kinds of weird flashlight clipping issues. Same thing with the valve-stem in earlier shots. Don’t know if it’s related.

Read full topic
